definition: passing line or score (in an examination)
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: He passed the exam by a narrow margin.
sentences.chinese: 他的考试成绩跟及格线擦边。

sentences.english: The minimum passing mark is 40 out of 100.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的最低及格线是白粉制的40分。

definition: to pass an exam or a test/to meet a minimum standard
to grade/to mark (student's work)/grade/score (of student's work)
horizontal line (in a fraction)/minimum passing score
negative score/minus (in grades, such as A-)
TOEFL/Test of English as a Foreign Language
(old) thanks to your lucky influence (polite reply to health inquiries)
